results.title: Porklips now
results.brief_description: Starring William Gray, Ernie Fosselius, John Brent, Mark Lee, Jim Turner. A comedy which casts a running loop parody over ‘Apocalypse Now’. Features Martin Sheen lookalike William Gray as “Dullard” who is sent to deal with a renegade butcher whose low, low prices threaten the profits of the Meatcutters Protective Association.

results.title: Pork: the meal with a squeal
results.brief_description: This work focuses on the world distribution of pigs. Also covers the breeds of pigs, farming pigs, different sections for different meats, and meatless by-products such as brush bristle, insulin, cortisone, and thyroid extract.

results.title: Pork on the farm: killing, curing and canning
results.brief_description: Details the best methods for raising pigs for home use (as distinct from marketing them) are given; correct slaughtering methods are shown; the general principles which give nest results in cutting up pork are demonstrated; and detailed descriptions of carious ways of curing pork.

results.title: Porgy and Bess
results.brief_description: This version of George and Ira Gershwin’s folk opera in three acts, has music by the London Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Simon Rattle, and is based on the original Glyndebourne Festival Opera stage production. The story is based on the novel by DuBose and Dorothy Heyward, this is the story of an ill-fated love affair between two strong-willed African-Americans in the deep south of America in the early 1900s. Willard White shines as Porgy and Cynthia Haymon is brilliant as the headstrong Bess. Damon Evans gives a wonderful performance as Sportin’ life.

results.title: Porcupine quill work
results.brief_description: Discusses the use of porcupine quills for decorative purposes. Also explains the historical significance of its use among the Indians, which pre-dates the arrival of Europeans to North America.

results.title: Population and the American future
results.creator_credit: John Martin, Craig Fisher and Fisher Film Group
results.brief_description: The official report of the National Commission on Population and the American future, which was created by Congress at the request of President Nixon. Summarises the effects of increased population growth, with conclusions and recommendation on how to stop this growth. One of the recommendations made by the Report was “to bring the working poor and those who cannot find work, into the mainstream of the economic society” - interesting projections into the future (circa 1973)!

results.title: Popular psychology
results.creator_credit: Julia Murphy, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: How much faith should one put in popular psychology? When psychological theories are all around, how is the lay person to keep proper perspectives? The film centers the question around two women, Barbara and Jane. Barbara is regarded by Jane as indulging in the psychology fad, looking for problems in her husband and child to practise her do-it-yourself analysis. But, wonders Jane, is a little psychology better than none at all? The question is left open for discussion.
